question_sentence: President Trump has unveiled plans for a "gold card" visa for the ultra-wealthy, at what price tag?
evidence: The proposed "gold card" visas would offer permanent residency and a "road to citizenship", replacing the current EB-5 visas for foreign investors, which only require a $1 million investment. Announcing the plan, Trump speculated that up to one million of the visas could be issued.

question_sentence: What major religious festival is expected to begin today?
evidence: The festival is the ninth month of the Islamic lunar calendar, and the period of fasting and prayer begins with the first sighting of the new crescent moon, which is expected this evening.

question_sentence: What percentage of the vote did the far-right party AfD receive in Sunday's election in Germany?
evidence: Although the far-right party almost doubled its vote share from the last election, moderates and progressives had feared "silent" AfD voters might give the party an even stronger showing. Turnout was 83% – the highest since Germany's reunification in 1990 – but left-wing parties swept up a large chunk of the additional votes.

question_sentence: Which tech giant pledged to invest $500 billion in the US over the next four years?
evidence: Tech giant Apple said it would spend $500 billion in the US, including hiring 20,000 new employees and helping build a large server factory in Houston to power its artificial intelligence offerings. However, the company will "continue to make the bulk of what it sells – iPhones, iPads and Macs – in Asia".

question_sentence: Which newspaper will now print opinion pieces that only promote "personal liberties" and "free markets"?
evidence: Jeff Bezos had come under fire before the election for refusing to allow the paper he owns to endorse a candidate – a move seen as beneficial to Donald Trump. Now the Amazon founder has said columns that do not conform to his prescribed agenda "will be left to be published by others".

question_sentence: Which store announced it was closing all 800 of its locations after filing for bankruptcy?
evidence: The 82-year-old fabric and crafts store will close after liquidation firm GA Group and a lender acquired most of its assets in an auction. Joann also filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy in January, marking its second filing in less than a year.

question_sentence: New figures revealed that 14,000 children in England have been accused of what in the past 10 years?
evidence: In the past year, witchcraft allegations have been linked to 2,180 social services cases, with some children subjected to abuse or forced to undergo exorcisms. A new documentary, "Kindoki Witch Boy", made by a survivor of witchcraft allegations, aims to draw attention to the scale of the problem.

question_sentence: According to a Pew Research Center study, what percentage of Americans currently identify as Christian?
evidence: The third Religious Landscape Study by the Pew centre found that 62% of Americans identify as Christian, a decline from 78% in 2007. The study also revealed that the share of people with no religious affiliation has remained stable at 29%, and younger generations show less religious affiliation than older ones.

question_sentence: On Tuesday, UK newspapers replaced their usual front pages with a shared warning about what?
evidence: The front page "wrap" covers, bearing the slogan "MAKE IT FAIR", were part of a coordinated day of action across the UK's creative industries protesting a change in the law, which they claim would make it easier for AI companies to train their software on copyrighted writing, art and music.

question_sentence: Where did Colombian police find hidden cocaine on a man attempting to board a flight to Amsterdam?
evidence: A 40-year-old man attempting to smuggle 220 grams of cocaine hidden under his toupee was arrested by Colombian police. Officers discovered the drugs, worth $10,500, after removing the wig at security.

question_sentence: Which American restaurant chain added a surcharge to egg-based meals due to bird flu shortages?
evidence: Denny’s has joined a growing number of restaurants responding to the nationwide egg shortage by adding a temporary surcharge to egg-based meals.

question_sentence: President Donald Trump said the US will soon sell a “gold card” to wealthy foreigners, giving them the right to live and work in the country. Around how much will the “gold card” cost?
evidence: President Trump said on Tuesday that a new “gold card” will offer a path to citizenship in exchange for a $5 million fee.

question_sentence: The world’s largest religious gathering wrapped up this week. Where did the holy festival occur?
evidence: More than 620 million people attended the Maha Kumbh Mela, or the festival of the Sacred Pitcher.

question_sentence: Which US retailer is going out of business and shuttering all its stores?
evidence: Fabrics and crafts retailer Joann, which has been a destination for generations of quilters and knitters for more than 80 years, is going out of business.

question_sentence: Which country declared a state of emergency this week following a massive electricity blackout?
evidence: Chile's President Gabriel Boric blamed electricity companies for a widespread blackout that plunged most of the country into darkness, including the capital Santiago.

question_sentence: What percentage of the US food supply is made up of ultraprocessed foods?
evidence: Ultraprocessed foods, which are made with ingredients you wouldn’t normally find in a supermarket or your kitchen, make up as much as 70% of the US food supply.

question_sentence: A string of aviation mishaps have raised concerns about air travel safety. Which airline was involved in a near collision on a Chicago runway this week?
evidence: A Southwest Airlines plane had a close call with a private jet that entered a runway without authorization Tuesday at Chicago Midway International Airport.

question_sentence: Which country marked three years of war with Russia this week?
evidence: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky praised Ukraine's "absolute heroism" as the country on Monday marked the third anniversary of Russia's full-scale invasion.

question_sentence: Which tech company says it will invest $500 billion in its US facilities to avoid certain tariffs?
evidence: Apple announced Monday it will invest $500 billion to expand its US facilities, a move that could help it avoid new tariffs on goods imported from China.

question_sentence: The next crewed flight mission of private space company Blue Origin will carry an all-female crew, including which pop star?
evidence: Singer Katy Perry is among the six-person crew who will launch on Blue Origin’s New Shepard vehicle. The company has not announced a specific date for the mission.
